concept.title: Hot Air Pipe
concept.shortdesc: The hot air pipe transfers heat from the exhaust pipe to the carburetor to aid in gasoline vaporization during cold weather operation.

conbody.p: The hot air pipe serves as a thermal conductor between the exhaust system and carburetor. By channeling hot air from around the exhaust pipe to the carburetor, it facilitates the vaporization of gasoline for improved engine performance.
While this component is essential during cold weather operation, it should typically be removed during hot weather conditions for optimal performance.
